creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: profile and upper body of two men facing each other; L man has wide shoulders and wears a large plume on his hat, and a cape over PR arm; man at R has mustache, a furry hat with a feather, and a furry cloak
inscription:
Signature

-- inscribed in graphite on recto, below platemark: [121-11]
-- in graphite on verso and on mount: [D.V. 400]
portfolio: From From Recueil de divers griffonnements et preuves, Plate 11 d'eau-forte
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: monogram in plate, lower right: [SDB. fec.]
title: Busts of Two Men Wearing Turbans with Feathers, From Recueil de divers griffonnements et preuves, Plate 11
